article.title: UN layout formatting specification for UBL Order Change instances

section.title: Order change formatting specification
section.para: This formatting specification describes a rendering of the UBL Order Change document model numbered according to the United Nations Layout Key for Trade Documents guidelines for application for the 230 Order Change form.
For a list of all formatting specifications and an overview of the documentation conventions, please visit the formatting specification home page.

section.title: Status
section.para: This specification has no formal status at this time. It should not be considered a reference interpretation of UBL documents. Feedback is sought from users of stylesheets that implement this formatting specification regarding suggestions for change for consideration by the OASIS UBL committees for incorporation into these formatting specifications.

Presentational semantics may never be formalized or normative in the UBL project due to differing international requirements and conventions for the presentation of information found in business documents. This document contains only examples from a few of what will probably be many available UBL stylesheet libraries.

section.title: Layout order and information
section.para: Items in this formatting specification are ordered roughly from the laid out fields on the form in the order left-to-right, top to bottom.
Certain descriptions are verbatim quotes from the United Nations guidelines document.

Important: the rendering of a number of fields is very simplified, reflecting a Western European interpretation of a subset of fields (as in names and addresses). User requirements need to be better understood for the level of granularity in these formatting specifications.

section.title: Miscellaneous information
section.para: The following information is unrelated to the visible fields of the form.

section.title: Document header information
section.para: This information shows up in the window-title bar of the HTML browser, and in the document title supported by some XSL-FO processors.

section.title: Main document and party information
section.para: Header information is associated with the form as a whole, not to the individual items of goods.

section.title: Seller
section.para: These fields are used to provide the name and address of the sender of the goods.
Note that only one of cbc:CountrySubentity and cac:CountrySubentityCode need be used, with preference to cbc:CountrySubentity if it exists.

section.title: Order change number
section.para: This number is a unique number assigned to the order change by the buyer.

section.title: Order reference (Buyer's)
section.para: This number is the reference number of the original order.

section.title: Date
section.para: This field states the date of the order change.

section.title: Order issue date
section.para: This fields provides the date of the original order.

section.title: Change sequence number
section.para: The Order Change Sequence Number is a unique number assigned to ensure the proper sequencing of the change requests.

section.title: Order reference (Seller's)
section.para: This field provides a seller assigned reference to the original order.

section.title: Consignee
section.para: These fields are used to provide the name and address of the receiver of the goods involved in the transaction.
Note that only one of cbc:CountrySubentity and cac:CountrySubentityCode need be used, with preference to cbc:CountrySubentity if it exists.

section.title: Buyer
section.para: These fields are used to provide the name and address of the buyer of the goods involved in the transaction.
Note that only one of cbc:CountrySubentity and cac:CountrySubentityCode need be used, with preference to cbc:CountrySubentity if it exists.

section.title: Line item information
section.para: Line item information is associated with the individual item of goods in the order change.

section.title: Item / References
section.para: The first reference is the buyer's assigned reference to the line item.
The second reference is the seller's assigned reference to the line item.

section.title: Description
section.para: This provides a free text description of the line item.

section.title: Country of origin
section.para: This field is used to provide to country of origin for the line item.

section.title: Commodity code
section.para: This field is used to provide the commodity code for the line item.

section.title: Quantity
section.para: This field states the number of order change items ordered for the line item.

section.title: Unit price
section.para: This field is used to specify the unit price of the line item.

section.title: Amount
section.para: This field states the actual line item amount which will be quantity multiplied by the unit price, the result is not calculated it will be transmitted.

section.title: Summary information
section.para: Summary information is associated to the entire order change and not to any individual line item.

section.title: Notes
section.para: This notes field is used for any free text information that relates to the entire order change.

section.title: Total amount
section.para: Two data fields populate this one form field: the currency and the total amount.
The total amount is the total of all the individual line items and is not calculated it will be transmitted.

section.title: Name of signatory
section.para: This fields identified the name of the signatory.

section.title: Place and date of issue
section.para: The above fields provide information relating to the date and place of issue of the order change.
Note that only one of cbc:CountrySubentity and cac:CountrySubentityCode need be used, with preference to cbc:CountrySubentity if it exists.

section.title: Signature
section.para: This field is not currently being filled automatically as it is a manual entry.
